article:
'Storage' in human memory is one of three core process of memory, along with
recall and encoding. It refers to the retention of information, which has been
achieved through the encoding process, in the brain for a prolonged period of
time until it is accessed through recall. Modern memory psychology
differentiates the two distinct type of memory storage: short-term memory and
long-term memory. In addition, different memory models have suggested variations
of existing short-term and long-term memory to account for different ways of
storing memory.
